name: Dowser
description:
You are the vanguard. You are the trailblazer. You are the cheapest and fastest way to get a rough idea of where water might be on that barren but probably totally fine unexplored planet down there. Take this stick and hold it like so, and when it points toward the ground, shove one of these stakes where it's pointing and we'll drop a well as close as we can. If the well detects something, it'll signal us, and we'll throw down some habitat pods. Apologies in advance for any bad trajectories. We're all doing our best up here. Anyway, you'll probably need to move the pods to get them close to the wells. They'll take care of the rest, but they can be a bit of trouble to move, so we're giving you some boots, too. These are real nice, latest steel-toe tech, really fashionable and very chic boots. They also have excellent stomp ability, and just first rate kick action. Go ahead, give 'em a little walkabout. So anyway, that's it. If you'll just, uh, get in, and, yeah, you may need to, uh, oh, you got it. You good? Cool. Do your best!

WASD to move

Space to jump

Mouse to look around

Left Mouse to kick (hold to charge)

Right Mouse to place beacon for well

M for Map

T for Tooltips

Made in 14 days for the 2022 Holistic3D Game Jam. Theme was "Well that wasn't supposed to happen." The punctuation was theirs, and I could only assume that the "well" was meant as a noun as there was no comma after it. It was this or a game about Deepwater Horizon.

P.S. tried to do a last minute WebGL build, but as usual the shaders got a bit screwy and it'll need more work, so we're running with a windows build for the jam. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Thanks for playing!

P.P.S. I think I managed to get saving working. I haven't tried serialization in earnest before, and struggled through the final hours to get it working on a looping planet. But I think it works. I'm pretty sure it works. Please let me know if you try booting up the game a second time and see your past works spread before you.
